## Project Contents
## NOTE:  CodeBook2.md - LITE is trimed / revised version of codebookmd due to size, issues relating the abiliy to open in a web broswer - Describes the data and the steps taken to summarize the data.

 1. CodeBook .md - Describes the data and the steps taken to summarize the data.
 2. run_analysis.R - R script to merge, extract, change labels and variables, and summarize the data to a TIDY date form.
 3. run_data_summary.txt - Output file generated by the run_analysis.R script.
 4. README.md - This file.

## The Process:
  a)	Download UCI dataset from web,save on local drive
  b)	Install dplyr package
  c)	Import the dplyr library
  d)	Read txt in the test datasets
       a.	Read in the x test data
       b.	Read in the y test data
       c.	Read in the subject test data
       d. Merge the test datasets into a single dataframe 
  e)	Read txt in the training datasets
     a.	Read in the x training data
     b.	Read in the y training data
     c.	Read in the subject training data
     d. Merge training datasets into a single dataframe 
  f)	Read in the data and identify column names
  g)	Read in the measurement labels dataset 
  h)	merge the datasets into a single dataframe 
  i)	merge the datasets into a single dataframe
  j)	Remove parentheses, hyphens and bad stuff from column names 
  k)	Fix repeating word(s) in columns
  l)	Read activity labels to be added to dataset
  m)	Trim activity labels in datasets
  n)	Group the running data by subject and activity
  o)	Calculate the mean of every measurement 
  p)	Write to text file
  q)	Summaries data / Relax
  


## The Run Analysis Code
1 Load the dplyr library
2 library(data.table)
3 library(devtoo s)
4 library(codebook)
5ibrary(dplyr)

# Download the UCI dataset in txt format, Load into R
# Read data - x test, y test, subject test
# Read in the data and identify column names
6 features <- read.table("./features.txt", header=FALSE, col.names = c("n","functions"))
7 activities <- read.table("./activity_labels.txt", header=FALSE, col.names = c("code", "activity"))
8 subject_test <- read.table("./subject_test.txt", header=FALSE, col.names = "subject")
9 x_test <- read.table("./X_test.txt", header = FALSE, col.names = features$functions)
10 y_test <- read.table("./y_test.txt", header=FALSE, col.names = "code")
subject_train <- read.table("./subject_train.txt", header=FALSE, col.names = "subject")
11 x_train <- read.table("./X_train.txt", header=FALSE, col.names = features$functions)
12 y_train <- read.table("./y_train.txt", header=FALSE, col.names = "code")

# Merge the datasets into a single dataframe 
# Combine testdf and traindf
13 X <- rbind(x_train, x_test)
14 Y <- rbind(y_train, y_test)
15 Subject <- rbind(subject_train, subject_test)
16 Merged_Data <- cbind(Subject, Y, X)

# Apply the measurement labels as column names 
17 TidyData <- Merged_Data %>% select(subject, code, contains("mean"), contains("std"))

# create column names
18 TidyData$code <- activities[TidyData$code, 2]

# Remove parentheses, hyphens and bad stuff from column names, fix 
# repeating word(s) in columns, create descriptive variable names
19 names(TidyData)[2] = "activity"
20 names(TidyData)<-gsub("Acc", "Accelerometer", names(TidyData))
21 names(TidyData)<-gsub("Gyro", "Gyroscope", names(TidyData))
22 names(TidyData)<-gsub("BodyBody", "Body", names(TidyData))
23 names(TidyData)<-gsub("Mag", "Magnitude", names(TidyData))
24 names(TidyData)<-gsub("^t", "Time", names(TidyData))
25 names(TidyData)<-gsub("^f", "Frequency", names(TidyData))
26 names(TidyData)<-gsub("tBody", "TimeBody", names(TidyData))
27 names(TidyData)<-gsub("-mean()", "Mean", names(TidyData), ignore.case = TRUE)
28 names(TidyData)<-gsub("-std()", "STD", names(TidyData), ignore.case = TRUE)
29 names(TidyData)<-gsub("-freq()", "Frequency", names(TidyData), ignore.case = TRUE)
30 names(TidyData)<-gsub("angle", "Angle", names(TidyData))
31 names(TidyData)<-gsub("gravity", "Gravity", names(TidyData))

# Group the running data by subject and activity, then
# calculate the mean of every measurement
32 FinalData <- TidyData %>%
33   group_by(subject, activity) %>%
34   summarise_all(list(mean))

# Write running_data to text file and data checks
35 Write.table(FinalData, "FinalData.txt", row.name=FALSE)
36 Str(FinalData)
37 Summary(FinalData)
38 END

```r
show_missing_values <- FALSE
if (has_labels(item)) {
  missing_values <- item[is.na(haven::zap_missing(item))]
  attributes(missing_values) <- attributes(item)
  if (!is.null(attributes(item)$labels)) {
    attributes(missing_values)$labels <- attributes(missing_values)$labels[is.na(attributes(missing_values)$labels)]
    attributes(item)$labels <- attributes(item)$labels[!is.na(attributes(item)$labels)]
  }
  if (is.double(item)) {
    show_missing_values <- length(unique(haven::na_tag(missing_values))) > 1
    item <- haven::zap_missing(item)
  }
  if (length(item_attributes$labels) == 0 && is.numeric(item)) {
    item <- haven::zap_labels(item)
  }
}
item_nomiss <- item[!is.na(item)]

# unnest mc_multiple and so on
if (
  is.character(item_nomiss) &&
  any(stringr::str_detect(item_nomiss, stringr::fixed(", "))) &&
  !is.null(item_info) &&
  (exists("type", item_info) && 
    any(stringr::str_detect(item_info$type, 
                            pattern = stringr::fixed("multiple"))))
  ) {
  item_nomiss <- unlist(stringr::str_split(item_nomiss, pattern = stringr::fixed(", ")))
}
attributes(item_nomiss) <- attributes(item)

old_height <- knitr::opts_chunk$get("fig.height")
non_missing_choices <- item_attributes[["labels"]]
many_labels <- length(non_missing_choices) > 7
go_vertical <- !is_numeric_or_time_var(item_nomiss) || many_labels
  
if ( go_vertical ) {
  # numeric items are plotted horizontally (because that's what usually expected)
  # categorical items are plotted vertically because we can use the screen real estate better this way

	if (is.null(choices) || 
	    dplyr::n_distinct(item_nomiss) > length(non_missing_choices)) {
		non_missing_choices <- unique(item_nomiss)
		names(non_missing_choices) <- non_missing_choices
	}
  choice_multiplier <- old_height/6.5
	new_height <- 2 + choice_multiplier * length(non_missing_choices)
	new_height <- ifelse(new_height > 20, 20, new_height)
	new_height <- ifelse(new_height < 1, 1, new_height)
	if(could_disclose_unique_values(item_nomiss) && is.character(item_nomiss)) {
	  new_height <- old_height
	}
	knitr::opts_chunk$set(fig.height = new_height)
}
